sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"重要的，重大的"之意。
means: significant ： 指某事物由于特别优秀或特别有意义而显得重要与突出。
important ： 最普通用词，指有权威、有影响的人或值得注意的、有价值的事物。

sentence.Network_en: In that year, two momentous discoveries were made.
sentence.Network_cn: 那一年，有两个重大发现。

sentence.Network_en: I am deeply honoured to be invited to this momentous occasion.
sentence.Network_cn: 能应邀出席如此重要的场合,我深感荣幸.

sentence.Network_en: The momentous news was that war had begun.
sentence.Network_cn: 重大的新闻是战争已经开始.

entry.tran: 重大的;关键的;有影响的
entry.def: If you refer to a decision, event, or change as momentous, you mean that it is very important, often because of the effects that it will have in the future.

example.ex: ...the momentous decision to send in the troops...
The past three years have been among the most momentous in world history.
example.tran: 过去的3年是世界历史上最重要的时期之一。

sentences.sentence: "deciding to drop the atom bomb was a very big decision"

auth_sentence.content: It was weightier, more momentous, more world-historical.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was weightier, more momentous, more world-historical.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was weightier, more momentous, more world-historical.

auth_sentence.content: For Europe too this is a momentous event.
auth_sentence.res_content: For Europe too this is a momentous event.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For Europe too this is a momentous event.

auth_sentence.content: It felt like a momentous day in euroland.
auth_sentence.res_content: It felt like a momentous day in euroland.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It felt like a momentous day in euroland.

sentences.en: The momentous news was that war had begun.
sentences.cn: 重大的新闻是战争已经开始。

jushi.english: There was no doubt it would be a momentous occasion.
jushi.chinese: 毫无疑问，那将是极为重要的场合。
